thread.title: Frank Gore wins Art Rooney Sportsmanship Award
thread.title_full: Frank Gore wins Art Rooney Sportsmanship Award

author: sports@indystar.com
title: Frank Gore wins Art Rooney Sportsmanship Award
text:
Frank Gore wins Art Rooney Sportsmanship Award IndyStar Sports , sports@indystar.com Published 8:37   | Updated 34 minutes ago Indianapolis Colts quarterback Andrew Luck (12) gives a hug to Colts running back Frank Gore (23) after the team's 24-20 victory over the Jacksonville Jaguars at Lucas Oil Stadium on Jan. 1, 2017. Gore ended his season with more than 1000 rushing yards. (Photo: Mykal_McEldowney/Indy_Star) 
Indianapolis Colts running back Frank Gore has been named the NFL's 2016 Art Rooney Sportsmanship Award winner. 
The prestigious award is given to the player who " best demonstrates the qualities of outstanding sportsmanship on the playing field, including fair play, respect for opponents and integrity in competition," a Colts news release said. 
Gore was honored awarded during NFL Honors, the NFL's annual award show. 
The NFL Foundation will award Gore $25,000 to be donated to the charity of his choice. 
Each team nominated a player for the sportsmanship award, and that list of 32 was eventually cut down to eight finalists. Gore was chosen among those eight by the NFL Legends Community. 
Previous winners of the award are the Oakland Raiders' Charles Woodson (2015) and the Arizona Cardinals' Larry Fitzgerald (2014).
